did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY

physdesc.label: Quantity:
physdesc.extent: 36.5 cubic feet, 6 map-case folders and 46 framed items

did.physdesc: Audio recordings, printed materials, publications, photographs.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: The Adler Archive includes letters, documents, manuscripts, images, magazine and newspaper articles, books, sound and video recordings, and other ephemera documenting the history of hip hop.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Bill Adler is an American music journalist and critic who specializes in hip hop. He was director of publicity at Def Jam Recordings between 1984 and 1990. Since the early 1980s he has promoted hip hop in a variety of capacities, including as publicist, biographer, record label executive, museum consultant, curator, and documentary filmmaker.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: The Adler Archive includes letters, documents, manuscripts, images, magazine and newspaper articles, books, sound and video recordings, and other ephemera documenting the history of hip hop. At the core of the Archive are files on more than 1400 hip hop artists and groups from the 1970s to the present. The files include press clippings, promotional head shots, record label press releases, promotional flyers and other ephemera.
The Adler Collection formed the basis for much of the illustrated content in the popular book Def Jam recordings: The first 25 years of the last great record label (2011).

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access:

p.emph: Box 45 is restricted until 2050

accessrestrict.p: Collection may be used one folder at a time.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Adler Hip Hop Archive, #8092. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

processinfo.p: Folder titles have been retained as they were written on the folders by Adler. They may include abbreviations, alternate spellings, or punctuation that differs from the actual name of a performer.
